Reviews.Title: “european hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grant L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic if your into rooms like prison cells with no hot water. Luckily the mattress blocking the corridoor wasnt a 'room' however it was a fire risk.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, no luxury included!”
Reviews.Author: toomanychildren
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, we paid around £60 for a 'double' room including breakfast. From the outside it looks like a nice hotel, only a couple of minutes walk from Kings Cross - great location! As soon as you step through to the reception you realise this is super budget. The reception area smells of smoke and is cheap through and through. However, the receptionist was friendly and helpful. We had a room at the end of a corridor on the ground floor - good for lack of noise from other customers. Appalling due to very loud and continual noise from what I suspect is the boiler which neighbours the room. (Room 73) This is bad luck, and I'm sure other rooms would have been fine noise-wise. The room was extremely tiny. The double bed was the smallest bed I've ever seen described as a double bed - I suspect about 4ft wide. The en suite was tiny too, I initially thought it was the cupboard. However the room and en suite were perfectly clean and the bed comfortable. Breakfast the next morning was in the basement, with windows so not too dingy. Not the best or worst breakfast I've ever had - it was adequate. The 'chef' lobbing toast across us into the toast section made us laugh ;0) It was an experience!! They also allowed us to store our backpacks at the hotel for two nights for nothing, which was really handy indeed. All in all it was a cheap and clean hotel in an excellent location. I would recommend, as long as people were thinking along the lines of a hostel rather than a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Christopher T
Reviews.Content: whist this hotel is not great or luxury, IT DOES NOT PRETEND TO BE. really dont know how people criticise this hotel, yes rooms small and need some decorating when paying £55 near kings cross nad breakfast included this hotel does what you need. we stay 1 night slept well, breakfast did us for most of day and 2 mins walk to train station yet not a noisy hotel. would recommend to anyone that is not snobby

Reviews.Title: “Basic but lots of plus's”
Reviews.Author: dorian2120
Reviews.Content: While the accomodation is basic and our room being small the location of the hotel was great and perfect for geting around.the breakfast was good and the staff attentive very good for the price

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: samvii
Reviews.Content: Located near king's cross station which is just a few minutes away by foot. Hotel room is a bit cramped but had all the basic amenities with cofee making facilities as well. The hotel provides breakfast as well which is tasty by the way. We booked a room with bathroom attached but they didn't provide any floor mat. Its slippery after bath. The friendly staff provided me with a towel as substitute.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad!”
Reviews.Author: Dodiegale
Reviews.Content: First the advantages: The hotel is in a wonderful location, on a garden square, about two minutes walk from Kings Cross Station (once you have located the exit on the south side of Euston Road). The outside of the hotel looks quite plush and even the inside is well-carpeted once you get beyond the reception area. I had asked for a quiet room and the receptionist must have looked at my request, taken in our age (my husband and I are in our 60s), and said "I had better give you a room on the first floor - room 55" Room 55 was at the back and was very quiet. It was also warm, a plus in December/January. The surfaces were clean - sheets, towels, etc. There were more than enough coat hangers. There was a plentiful supply of hot water. Now for the downside: I have stayed in several budget hotels in London but this was the first one where I was given just one towel. On the first night I asked for a second towel when I returned late at night and was handed one by the night receptionist. However, just two towels (for my husband and myself) were left again the following morning. There were no pictures on the walls (we could live with that) but a mirror in the bedroom would have been useful. Far worse was the fact that there was no light shade (just a naked bulb), no bedside light which meant one of us always had to get out of bed to switch off the light, and not a single hook. Anywhere! I know the Europa is a budget hotel but surely they could have managed just one hook in the bathroom... We didn't risk breakfast. Probably a mistake as, apart from the orange juice and the surly staff, the breakfast reviews sound quite positive. Instead we went to St Pancras Sation for breakfast each morning. Can recommend "Le Pain Quotidien" (but not budget!) The bathroom plug was broken and the television didn't work. I did report the television to reception and it had been fixed by the time we returned to the hotel later that day. I mentioned that the surfaces were clean - nice crisp sheets - and the towels were changed each day. However, my husband put his clothes in the drawers and, when he took out his scarf, it was covered with a thick layer of dust. There was also a piece of chewing gum stuck on top of the carpet between the twin beds which wasn't very pleasant. I couldn't really recommend this hotel because I have stayed in better budget accommodation for the same price in London. However, it was New Year, when many hotels double their prices, and the European seemed to maintain its normal tariff. Also the location, on a garden square so close to Kings Cross, was perfect for us. You can even walk into the centre if you are reasonably fit. We walked back to the Europa on New Year's Eve from Leicester Square. It took about 35 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: HarryAngstrom1
Reviews.Content: Actually not the worst hotel you wil find in this are of Lonodn in this price bracket. Very basic accommodation but with a decent breakfast. Very friendly and efficient staff.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty grim”
Reviews.Author: janelongnumber
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night - picked it because it was relatively cheap and very close to St Pancras - ideal for Eurostar. It's pretty grim and not particularly clean. Several quite grand old buildings knocked together and converted into loads of little bedrooms with cheap partition walls. The double bed seemed tiny and the room temperature seemed very high - resulting in a pretty uncomfortable night. Orange squash for breakfast was nasty. Location was fantastic - there are lots of small hotels in the Square and on the roads around it, not sure if any of them are any better - this may just be the general standard for the area and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good go give it a try bad points orange Sqaush and poor en suite & thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Thewonderinghobo
Reviews.Content: The room I booked was a double on suite I paid Â£75 a night here's what Â I thought:- Overall hotel building and position was good and the hotel was clean and tidy and there is a park out side and it is 5 mins walk to kings cross station all the staff where really helpful and nice. Â Score 6 out of 10 The room The room was bigger enough for two with basic furniture however it was clean and fresh towels where delivered every morning. However I feel Â£75 was a little pricy I would of been happier to pay Â£60-Â£65 tops. The walls where very thin and you can here everything that's going on Score 5 out of 10 The en-suite This was not great it was a bit small and very basic at certain times of the day the toilet smelt bad. And the sink was to low other than that it was clean-ish. Score 3 out of Â 10 Breakfast Well full English tea coffee and toast water cereal and orange Sqaush one thing I would change is the orange to real orange. However everything other than that was loverly even the breakfast bar you sit in is cafe style and nice SCORE 7 out of 10 In short well worth staying here as it is in a great location and it's a lot better than the Northumberland hotel around the corner which you should avoid at all costÂ

Reviews.Title: “3 nights was enough......”
Reviews.Author: MrsDaydream
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband have just recently spent 3 nights in London and chose this hotel for location and B&B facility - the staff were pleasant enough in the reception area (there is a lovely man who works the night shift who couldn't do enough - we went to the reception for some new batteries for the tv remote as it wasn't working but he came with a brand new tv for us with freeview!!) but not as pleasant in the breakfast/kitchen area. The hotel was easy enough to find (10 min walk from Euston station or right across the road from Kings Cross Underground) Our first night was spent on the 2nd floor at the front of the hotel (room 20) - upon arrival in the afternoon we were made up - lovely view out of the window, nice clean room, tv, brew facilites, etc - however during the night there might as well had not been a window as we could hear EVERYTHING - footsteps, conversations, sirens, cars, etc! My husband went to reception after the worst nights sleep and they agreed to move us to another room at the back of the hotel. Our new room was ground floor right to the end of the hotel (room 78 I think) which was a lot better - slightly larger too - however we were right next to the boiler/laundry room so could hear it firing up all through the night. We decided to stay as we didn't want to spend our holiday weekend packing and unpacking! On the plus side - this hotel was a very good location - right across from the Kings Cross tube - cheap for London at Â£75 p/n which obviously proves you get what you pay for. Breakfast was included in the price which was fab - A hot buffet breakfast consisting of sausage, beans, eggs (scrambled and fried), plum tomatoes and bacon. You get 2 slices of toast from the kitchen staff when you sit down at your table but don't expect a smile - also we asked for more toast and was met with a grunt - we had to ask twice more before it arrived! There was cereal, milk, tea/coffee, orange squash and water but make sure you don't use the sauces as they looked like they had been there a few years - plus the 'use by' date on one of the ketchup bottles was 2007!! (Maybe they just refilled them but we didn't want to risk it - they did look a bit grotty!) There are plenty of restaurants and cafes in this area with a McDonalds right on the corner of the street and a Pizza Express on the next block up. Our next stay in London would definately be in this area but we would probably pay that little bit extra and stay in the Premier Inn just a few mins walk up the road!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jessbeany
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for the Ritz this isn't it... Having said that the room was clean, the staff were friendly and location-wise this hotel was perfect (5-10 min walk from Euston). Yes, the room is a bit small but it's perfectly adequate for the price, totally fit for purpose... if you are planning a romantic break in London, this may not be the right hotel for you but we were basically using it as base and it was fine, no complaints at all- people moaning should perhaps bear in mind that you get what you pay for and this was very good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “the worst of London”
Reviews.Author: tpdv21
Reviews.Content: Welcome to the Gulag. If there was any truth in advertising, European Hotel would position itself thus: "We are relatively affordable â€“ but not cheap, 'cos London doesn't do cheap â€“ and near King's Cross, so you'll stay here and put up with our cramped, conditions, shoddy standards and complete lack of interest in your comfort, because you couldn't find/afford any better" First, the positives. I asked for a quiet room on an upper floor with a view, and that is what room 54 is. The toilet and shower-room were separate, always a good thing. Hot water in the shower took a while but water pressure was fine. One of the cleaners almost smiled one morning. Now the negatives. Staff at check-in had a world-weary air of resignation. The TV only had BBC 1, but if you fiddle with it you lost that, too. Breakfast is anarchic â€“ only two staff trying to cope with far too many punters. They are stressed and take it out on guests â€“ they practically throw the toast at you. Unappetizing sausages, bacon swimming in fat, and the scrambled eggs were bottom scrapings on all three mornings. On one afternoon I came down to this space to use a table for working on the laptop â€“ a surly receptionist came down and told me I "wasn't allowed" in this space. I think one of the kitchen staff grassed me up. Yes, this is a hotel where the staff complain about the guests! The square outside is nice but it is King's Cross so expect shouts, loud car stereos, and 'colourful' characters. The hallways stink of cigarette smoke. Wallpaper peels, signs of age and neglect everywhere. My only exit was also marked Fire Exit â€“ is this legal? I made sure my bedroom window opened all the way just in case. I stayed for three nights on business on my own. No lifts, so definitely not for old people, couples on romantic breaks, or people looking to relax. Strictly functional because of the location. I booked because better alternatives were full. Therefore I had low expectations, but the chaos of breakfast really surprised me. This is the kind of place only London can get away with, unfortunately. Stay only as a last resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good value good service along with good food.”
Reviews.Author: Rickgathercole
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the previous reviews I have come to the conclusion that we are a nation of nit pickets. We stayed in room 19 and we found it suited us perfectly. Reasonably clean constant hot water and a working telly. We found the staff friendly and helpful, we asked for extra pillows and they where produced with a smile, we asked for extra towels and so where they all with a smile. The food was reasonable the eggs & best rindless back bacon where great. Hot toast was delivered at the speed of light. & ok the orange juice was naff but what should you expect for a budget hotel. If you want to spend Â£353 a night for perfection go across the road and stay at the big posh place on the top kings cross station Seeing as we where staying 4 nights I thought it was better to spend Â£300 at this hotel rather than Â£1412 across the road. In short this is a budget hotel providing a fair service at a fair price and I would come back. In fact we have just rebooked for 1 nights stay when we come back from our holiday in the far east so we can relax before our trip back home up north

Reviews.Title: “A Dump.”
Reviews.Author: Dale G
Reviews.Content: I was booked into a basic room by my employer for 2 nights. The room was half a cupboard on the 4th floor with only a sink. The shared toilet had been used before whoever was last in it realized that it was broken the other toilet was out of use, the shared shower was disgusting. I paid another Â£25 to be moved to an en-suite room which turned out to be the room opposite. It was also tiny but clean enough, however there was no water pressure so the shower didn't work. I then discovered the TV also didn't work. It was very noisy from both inside and outside the hotel so not even restful. Breakfast was of a greasy spoon standard with orange squash instead of juice. I didn't bother having any on the 2nd morning. I would take a cardboard box next time and save the Â£100 that the 2 nights cost.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but staff unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: Daisyscot
Reviews.Content: Staff were unfriendly, breakfast very poor, although cooked well there was no fruit juice, only one cereal and no vegetarian option. Full English was included in the price and I think the staff thought they were doing guests a favour not a service. Customers were told to get food quickly when arriving at 9.15. Only white medium bread for toasting, 2 slices per person, don't ask for more! Staff were loud, kitchen very noisy. Rooms tidy, very small, no chairs in room. No safety information, where to go if fire alarm sounded etc.

Reviews.Title: “London dreams / Nighmare!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sdy30
Reviews.Content: We had basement triple room. With great difficulty somehow managed to carry suitcase through narrow staircase and to add that was sight of cramped room,so also bathroom. One double bed and one single bed occupied the whole room hardly leaving any space to move around. so horrible!! Do not ask about bathroom!!! Room service was ok. Except good location. i.e. St . Pancras International and King's cross stations. Yes, but breakfast was good. It is totally nightmare!!!!! Opt this if you really do not have any choice.

Reviews.Title: “Cheerless and Expensive”
Reviews.Author: Torvie
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel I've ever stayed in and expensive at 150 pounds per night. We had a basement room which was reached by a narrow musty staircase, difficult to negotiate with heavy suitcases. There were 4 single beds and a small double bed (we were 3) so roomy enough, clean and clean linen and towels. Maybe we paid extra for all the beds! The bathroom was something else - similar to my primary school toilets from the 1960s. Nowhere to hang towels, small grotty shower, basic and icky. On the plus side close to St Pancras for Eurostar (easy walk with cases) and the breakfast was good. There is no in room safe and the security is poor (very light lock on door, we could have climbed out our window easily) so need to carry all valubles with you which was a hassle. To call this a hotel is an insult to most hotels. More a boarding house. We stayed 2 nights which was depressing. If you are desperate, stay 1 night and leave early for the Eurostar next day. There must be better for the price in London. At most worth 60 pounds per night for 3 people.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AVOID FORGET OR REGREAT!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Isabella Melendez UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is the worst hotel i've ever stayed in. The room i had was a quad room! So they say!!! There was no room to breath! Never mind move!!!! I was sooo furious!! Told them the internet pics were v missleading!! She said "thats the internet for u" !!! Cheek!!!! On top of that the bathroom was 1X1 sooooo small!!!!!!!!!!! There was no room to move!!!! And most importantly it was DIRTYYYYYYYYY!!! Shower head disgusting ! Tiles god.... Couldnt even sayy!!! Mirror floor etc!!!!! The room beds were incrediblyy small!! The double bed was a single bed a bit bigger and the singles were tiny! Only my 7 yyear old fitted in there! The courtains were filthy!!! And the window full of dust!! Plus it was soooo hot!! Opened the bloody the window and a smell of marihuana came in! Which a resident there remarked it was brilliant as he walked passed!!!!! Im soo fuming!! Is not worth staying there for the location!!! As its alll not worth it!! And on top of that i paid 120 pounds!!!! For that f'in room!!! NEVER STAY THERE PEOPLE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: gypsy49
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the European for access to the Euro Star. This hotel is less than `budget`in every way. The rooms are tiny, just enough space for a double bed, the bathroom more like a closet. The water pressure in the shower was almost non existant. How this hotel can charge the prices it does and get away with it is beyond me. If it wasnt for its location to St Pancras l doubt there would be any returning customers. A complete ripoff.

Reviews.Title: “that's not a double bedroom”
Reviews.Author: angryeli
Reviews.Content: If you just stay in london for a couple of days and if you are going to use your hotel room only for its bed, well the hotel is worth. Otherwise, keep away...rooms are non existent, the bathroom is minimal, the plus is a tradition english breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “clean and great location, but still to expecieve for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: Maria_0o
Reviews.Content: I wrote the hotel a letter, because we were a little bit shocked by the bad reviews. Their response was that they had booked us a very nice, clean room. And so they did. Our room was a bit small, but it was clean with a fine bathroom and best of it, the hotel has a great location. Only thing is that it is far to expencieve for what you get. In any other big city you will pay half the price for such a hotel. But this is London and it is hard to find anything cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “What's the problem ... it's a themed hotel, isn't it?”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsW2010
Reviews.Content: We booked the European Hotel as a cheap place to get our heads down before an early Eurostar train to Paris the next day (although it wasn't that cheap, really - we paid Â£75). I was aware that it didn't have shining reviews on here, but the latter few seemed OK, so I thought maybe the owners had renovated or at least upped their game. Well, I don't know what everyone's complaining about ... they obviously don't get that it's a themed hotel, based on a prison experience. Genius! Our ground-floor room in the European Hotel was a tiny, well-appointed cell with compact furniture that must have been designed for a caravan. The bed was perfect for a cosy night's sleep: how romantic of the owners to have installed not a double bed but one the size of 1.5 singles! The lumps and springs added a touch of the unexpected to our night's sleep. And the single flat pillows were an elegant nod towards comfort. For a touch of gritty authenticity, there was chewing gum stuck to the wall, ripped wallpaper and a tiny bloodstain on the bedside cabinet where someone must have banged their hip trying to manoeuvre around the miniscule corner. We also admired the Tesco carrier bag smothering the smoke detector and the strong, lingering smell of cigarettes. Our exposed ceiling lights didn't work (clever idea!) so we made do with the desk lamp on the bedside cabinet. We got about two hours' sleep, between us. This worked out pretty well, we realised the next day, as one of us was awake the whole time, keeping watch. The bathroom was something else: it must have taken months, maybe years, to cultivate such a repulsive mildew smell and to grow that amount of mould. The shower is probably one of only a handful in the whole world where you could come out dirtier than you were before. Wow! The rationing was fairly generous: there was 1/10th of a toilet roll left, which had been nicely dampened for our comfort. It was so tiny in there, I bashed my forehead on the shelf over the sink while trying to spit out my toothpaste. Innovative, huh? Unfortunately, we didn't get to sample breakfast ... we checked out the minute we opened our eyes and ran to the nearest McDonald's. Freedom at last!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: philiowa
Reviews.Content: Just off of Kings Cross Station the room was OK could have been a little cleaner it meet my standards but my wife was a little disappointed. The night manager gave us a great recommendation for an Italian restaurant. The Day shift when we checked in were very polite but I did run into a desk employee who seemed to have a problem being very nice to anybody. Due to the location and the fact that we had reserved the room 9 months ahead of time we got a great rate. For those who understand this comment it is a standard europen hotel small but I only sleep in the room. It meets my needs. I would stay there again given I wanted the same location and the rate was good.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel : )”
Reviews.Author: cfarry88
Reviews.Content: The first thing I have to say is; ignore the negative feedback that some people have put on here! Me and my girlfriend stayed here for 3 nights, and loved it! The hotel is set off Euston Road, in a quiet leafy square. The room is small but it is very cosy and tidy - there was easily enough room for both of us. We were also pleasantly suprised with the quality of the en-suite bathroom too, it had a great shower! The staff were extremely friendly and the breakfast was excellent! In addition, the location of the hotel is ideal, as Kings Cross/St Pancras Station are a minutes walk down the street. This a great place to stay, and I highly recommend it! : )

Reviews.Title: “What do you expect for Â£59?”
Reviews.Author: Chris0007
Reviews.Content: Not bad at all, despite negative reviews you get what you pay for. I had clean room with new-ish bathroom on top floor. Yes agree if you have trouble with stairs you are in trouble if you not on ground or 1st floor. Breakfast is hot buffet and will certainly do you for the day! I've stayed here before and from my stay this time I'd stay again if was on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny and dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: Charlie_wright11
Reviews.Content: Can only comment on the bottom floor rooms but the staff said they were pretty much the same throughout. Had to move rooms twice. Far too much money for what you got. Basic accommodation doesn't begin to describe it, showers really poor and extremely small, as are the rooms. The night staff/porter didn't seem to think that it was their job to quieten rowdy teenagers that screamed outside peoples rooms and in the corridors. The accommodation was one step up from a youth hostel but not as clean (the price definitely did not reflect this). Shop around as there are better hotels for pretty much the same price. Excellent location, really convenient, but money needs to be put back into the business to make it pleasant. Not very user friendly,e.g no lifts and older or physically challenged people would really struggle.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: vnk
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights with family. The room is fairly small and the bathroom even smaller, but the furniture in the room was completely new. The beds were quite narrow. Our room was on the 3rd floor and there is no lift - we didn't mind the walking. The room felt very fresh. Breakfast includes coffee, tea, juice, eggs, sausages, bacon, beans, toast, butter and jam. Free wifi was a big plus. This hotel is one in a row of many hotels on Argyle Square. Our room was facing the Square and it was rather quiet. We didn't have any negative experiences, although I do suppose that the locks on the doors could be safer. King's Cross underground station is a 3-minute walk from the hotel. Would recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable, noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: ericschlangen
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as it was for just one night and it was close to Kings Cross station. It was a terrible experience, the rooms are very small, the bathroom is even smaller and smells bad (damp). So I had to have the window open all night for ventilation, but the helicopters (to the nearby hospital?) kept me awake all night. And early in the morning the neighbours went to shower, so due to the thin walls I woke up very early. Breakfast was swimming in oil, coffee was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, questionable room”
Reviews.Author: leepixielee76
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a short stay at this hotel and I have to say the location is the only thing going for it. The rooms are small and very basic (no bedside lamp or anything else really) It seemed reasonably clean but the bathroom was awful! The bathroom in the room I stayed in was basically some false walls formed in the room into a make shift bathroom. The taps in the sink didn't work and the shower was too horrendous to even venture a trip into...had some sort of vinyl on the flooring of the shower which didn't look very clean. All in all I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Linda155032
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience. The rooms were clean(a little small), the staff was very pleasant and helpful. It is 1/2 block from the "King's Cross tube" making getting around town very easy. Also, at the corner there was a very helpful travel/tour agent. The breakfast was OK. No fresh fruit, but considering the cost, quite alright.I would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “One get what one pay for”
Reviews.Author: gunric
Reviews.Content: It looked good on the web so we booked it although it seemed a bit cheap. It turned out to be cheap. You should stay here if you have no problems with claustrophobia, sleep well anywhere, do like "English breakfast" and cannot add some extra pounds for the night. Positive: The room was quite clean. The floor was not the ordinary dirty wall-to-wall fitted carpet, but a nice "wood" floor. Negative: The people working there were not the excellence of service. The room (room 28) was the smallest I have stayed at in London. A small bed (140 cm? in the double room) with easy-to-feel springs, was put towards two walls with only about 50 cm left on one side and about 40 cm in the foot end. The bathroom was so small so it was a problem to turn around without pushing the door open by mistake. The wardrobe almost fell by itself. The view from the window was a brick wall 2 meters away. The room was everything but sound proof. Two nights I was woken up by a screaming baby (not blaming the baby) and arguing couples. Fans in the surrounding bathrooms and also what people did in their bathrooms was easily heard. If you are disabled in any way, chose somewhere else to stay, the corridors are narrow and breakfast is served in the basement with steep, narrow stairs. I would be a nightmare to be in the house in case of a fire... Breakfast (bacon, beans, fried egg, scrambled eggs, hot tomato, sausage, tea, coffee, orange juice, toast with butter) was served in a small, noisy room.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: pammy62
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed at the European Hotel and found the staff very helpful, the breakfast very good because it was buffet style made it better. Our room was cozy and comfortable and we liked it that the hotel came in and made the rooms up every morning. We would recommend this hotel to anybody and we would most certainly stay here again. Thank you for making our weekend so special.

Reviews.Title: “stay here only when all else fails”
Reviews.Author: diddledoo32
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights before setting off on eurostar for an anniversay cruise, The receptionist saw we had two large cases so she said she would change our room to one with no stairs, so we were given room 26, on the corridor just behind the reception desk. But once in the room i wondered if we should of taken the room up the stairs as room 26 was terrible. We paid Â£70.00 a night for a disgusting hotel. Our light fitting was hanging off the ceiling and touching the light bulb, so that could catch fire if it was left on too long. We asked at reception where the tv remote control was, and we were told that they kept getting stolen so there was none.The handle on the toilet was hanging off. There was POWDERED milk (YUCK) so we went and bought a pint for our room and kept it in the sink to keep it cool. There was one pillow each on a very small double bed (it was really a large single). Breakfast was a nightmare, as reception told us that breakfast was served until 9.00am, but one man asked for some more bacon as there wasn't any left and he was told that he was too late and that they stopped cooking at 8.50, but we were in the breakfast room at 8.20 and they had run out of all the cooked food, so we had to wait for some to be cooked, also there was no cups, glasses or plates until they had washed them up. it was terrible, and when the food was ready it wasn't very nice and not much of it.The most worrying thing of all is that our room had NO fire or emergency instructions on the door, so if there was a fire we wouldn't know which way to go. So anyone coming to london PLEASE shop around as there are lots of better value and SAFER places to stay,

Reviews.Title: “Dont read the bad reviews..!!!”
Reviews.Author: josiebrown331
Reviews.Content: Booked the European Hotel for 3 nights 4th - 7th March 2011. After reading the reviews I was very worried about what to expect. Once we arrived, we were greeted at reception by a very nice lady who was very helpful throughout our stay. All staff were friendly. Breakfast was wonderful and our room was small but CLEAN. If your planing on spending most of your time in your room, then maybe this hotel isnt for you, but if you only need a good hearty breakfast and a bed to sleep in, then book, and enjoy your trip to London, as I did. I will be booking again later this year and have no worries about returning to the same hotel. Location is great for sightseeing.... If your going to use the tube or bus for most of your trips out, then I suggest you buy an Oyster card.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard for the price”
Reviews.Author: loutel
Reviews.Content: We booked here for a last minute break. We were given a double room en suite including breakfast. For the location is very good. Rooms were basic but clean, new & tidy. A good sized shower room & toilet. TV had all working channels. Tea & Coffee supplied in the room. When we asked for some more we got it. Breakfast was buffet style & on par with little chef.... it was fine. Dining room was clean. We would have stayed another night but they were fully booked but the lady on reception phoned every where she could think of for us without being asked to. Ignore most of the negative reviews on here it is worth a stay for good location and good price.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: egenan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel only one night, before taking the Eurostar to Paris. Except for the location everything was awful. We got a room for five people in basement. Room and bathroom were dirty, we did not use the shower as it was disgusting as well as the basin and the toilet. Corridors and stairs are so narrow that I wonder if they comply with safety rules. If we would have missed breakfast it would have been better. Staff at the reception just useless, they got our reservation on an handwritten piece of paper. My advise is to avoid this hotel. It is not for free and there are plenty of other hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in worse, but good location”
Reviews.Author: Docskeg-13
Reviews.Content: The European Hotel has a very convienient location about 3 minutes walk from Kings Cross/St Pancras. The hotel itself is very, very basic. It is not quite as bad as some reviews have it - I have definately seen worse places but it is far from ideal. The room (ours was on the first floor) was tiny, but that didn't stop them adding an en-suite. Problem there was the strange smell that came from either the shower drain or the toilet (didn't want to get too close to check!). Needless to say the en-suit was left tightly closed. On the up side the bedding was clean and so were the towels. If you are on a tight budget and are not too sensitive to strange smells it is ok for a night but I would definately say it is worth spending a little more to get a better nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: tl200277
Reviews.Content: Tiny room (literally 3m x 2m!), walls are very thin and you can hear everything in the rooms around you. Not very clean - small hairs found in shower. Shower curtain was dirty, and the floor was dangerously slippery. Breakfast was too bad to eat - well below greasy spoon standard. We were booked in for 3 nights but had to make alternative arrangements for the last 2 nights as we could not stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting and totally unsuitable for a wheelchair user”
Reviews.Author: happyhols4us
Reviews.Content: We booked this reservation in good faith after emailing the hotel that my grandson was in a wheelchair. They said they could accomodate our needs. They clearly didnt. There was no wheelchair ramp into the hotel , we could not even get the wheelchair through the door into the room , breakfast was down stairs and the shower cubicle was totally unsutible for a wheelchair user. It was also dirty and old. The window in the room had been smashed and was covered with sellotape? there was graffiti carved on the back of the door with a knife. and the whole room smelt of damp. Our room had a huge puddle under the bed and the duvet and cover were both soaked. I complained to the night porter who got us a new cover but could not find a clean duvet so we had to use the wet one? he said the window had been open all day and it must have been raining? As we had arrived late at night from France we were all tired and my grandson had to have his medication we left as soon as we could in the morning with out breakfast. The hotel refused to give us a refund as they said they could have given the room to others if we hadnt stayed. DISGUSTING.

Reviews.Title: “not bad for the for the money it cost. we stayed four nights.”
Reviews.Author: wildcatfan190729
Reviews.Content: some rooms are small ( ours was fine). four of us agreed that the breakfast was very good and we have stayed in much bigger places. would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: LongTallAlly
Reviews.Content: Booked a twin room through priceline.co.uk in order to attend a club night at the nearby La Scala. The only redeeming feature of this terrible hotel is that it was a quick 2 minute walk to our venue however the truly disgusting and miserable service meant that I would rather have been forced to pay Â£100 to get a taxi to a hotel anywhere else in London than actually stay here. If I hadn't been travelling with my 6'5 male friend I would NOT have stayed the night. We paid Â£65 for our poky, smelly, dirty little basement room with an ensuite that we didn't actually use as it was so filthy. The furniture was covered in cigarette burns, the television didn't work and the lamp was missing a bulb even though it was plugged in and turned on. The heating was on full blast all the time making the room unbearably hot and increasing the stench. We didn't use the shower due to the condition of the place however when brushing our teeth we noticed that the sink was broken with the plug permanently wedged in so the water didn't drain away. I had the worst nights sleep of my life the walls are paper thin and the beds are uncomfortable plus we were kept awake by a lady having very noisy sexual relations in a room near ours. It certainly sounded like she had relations with a couple of men which should give you an indication of the calibre of this hovel. Disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL KNOWN TO MAN!!!AVOIDDDDDDDDDDDDD!!”
Reviews.Author: Pilbo8787
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel i have ever been to in my life!! Infact it isn't even a hotel, its a a s**thole!! On approach to the "hotel" it looked ok, but as soon as you enter the reception area (smaller than a kennel) you are greeted, by the most miserable looking woman on the planet! She gave us the key and sent us to room 2, which was down a tight stairwell, leading to an open kitchen, which smelt like rotten eggs!! Then as you head down the smallest corridor known to man, the number of the room is dangling off the door! As you enter the room, there is a great stench, that gets stuck up your nose, enough to make you sick! The room was tiny, far too small for 3 grown men. And we had an amazing view of iron bars on our window! The wort Â£85 ive ever sent...id have rather spent the night on Kings Cross stations floor! AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COSTS!!

Reviews.Title: “extremely terrible service, the worst hotel I've ever lived”
Reviews.Author: XINYI1986
Reviews.Content: the service in the front door is horrible and one of the reception ladies with black hair is extremely mean, my friend come to see me for a while and she insisted on charging me extra 10 pounds for every night. I lived there for 4 nights and she charged extra 40 pounds, I almost could stay one more day in London. It really killed my interest of visiting london. The shower is extremely small and the heating in the room was completely useless, it started working in the morning when i was going out...oh my god!!!

Reviews.Title: “good location but ot much else”
Reviews.Author: ziggark
Reviews.Content: stayed here with my 2 children, good location across the road from st pancras. room was a bit small, the sheets and towels were clean, the bath room was small and a bit mildewy. the people were friendly but there was no personal service. i would stay here again only because of its location to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Positively surprised”
Reviews.Author: HJKitty
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend decided to visit London for the first time. A friend of mine is there once or twice a year and she's always staying in this hotel. So, naturally we decided to go there, too. Flying fron Graz with Ryanair to Stansted we bought Stansted Express Return tickets on the plane (for 22 pounds) as they are cheaper this way. On Liverpool Station we bought an Oyster and went on the tube to Kings Cross. From there it's only a one munte walk to the hotel. From outside it was nice looking and there was not a lot of noise. The staff was friendly and we got our room on the third floor. As the corridor is small and I had a bit of a proble, adjusting to the tightness of space, but as I heard: most of London hotels are like this. Our room had a double. This was, what surprised me a little: it's a small double (but we slept comfortably on it!). The room had a TV, small closet and a tiny bathroom. Everything was clean, the bed was made daily and the towels were changed daily, too. A we were in the room for sleeping only it didn't matter that it was a little room. The breakfast (from 7 to 9 am) was English: toast with butter and marmelade, eggs, ham, beans,... coffe and tea, juice and cornflakes in a buffet. I don't really like En.B so I ate cornflakes, toast and an egg, but it was enough and accually good :) All in all: we were surpised, as we were expecting way less. We were there with our Student ID, so our room was about 40 pounds per person per night, which is really inexpesive. The location is the best, and for what we've paid it was excellent. I'm definitely going there when I'm back in London and am telling all my friend to go there, too. What I'd like to say in the end: London's hotels are not inexpesive in general and to get a nice one on a good location is mostly fiction :) I guess it all depends what you're used to. For me, as a student, it was perfect but for a businessman I belive it might have been a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “A crash pad; nothing more”
Reviews.Author: cq82
Reviews.Content: For Â£65 a night B&B in Bloomsbury, I pretty much got what I expected to get. The room was clean enough, and the bed was comfortable. It is sitiuated 100m from King's Cross / St Pancras, so was a big plus for me in that respect. The service from reception was friendly enough, but not overly helpful. But that said, I'll probably be looking to spend that little bit more next time I stay in the Capital and stay in a nicer place! As has been mentioned by other reviewers, is far more of a hostel than a 'hotel'. The room was fit for a single bed, not the 'double' they squeezed in there - if there was more than just me staying there, it would have been a real issue! The bathroom was like a closet and smelt of damp. And the biggest issue for me was the soundproofing, or should I say the distinct lack thereof. A couple of deliveries were made to some local hotels and businesses during the night, and I was awoken several times - the single pane windows meant that all the noise created came stright into the room. So I would fully recommend to any future residents to bring ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “They Lost My Things!”
Reviews.Author: GloriaPrado
Reviews.Content: Well, i was a guest of the hotel and left at the reception a bag to a friend of mine, warning the receptionist that my friend would pass a by after10 days to pick it up.What was my surprise when my frined sad the bag wasn't there! We inquired the hotel, that sad to us that it is "A HOTEL, NOT A PARCEL COLLCTION SERVICE". And more than this, when they realised they had lost my bag, they started to sayTHEY NEVER RECEIVED IT!! UNBELIAVEBLE!! They not even tried to solve the problem giving me the an indemnity. Really a shame.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: mfaisalk
Reviews.Content: I stayed between 16th and 21st. The rooms are so small, dirty and sofocating....service, next to nothing..........I would never like to return to this hotel...the only positive in this hotel is its location and nothing else............

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient but expensive and nothing like a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: samviet
Reviews.Content: I stayed in there for 3 nights with my cousin. I'm 29 and she's 16 years old. The European is more like a hostel than a hotel! We were in a tiny room in the last floor and the ceiling was very low so we spent as little time as possible in the room. The bathroom was also very small. Only one person could fit and you could not get dressed in there unless you do so in the shower. The room had too many furniture. When you have such a small place you should definitely put as little furniture as possible... We could not sleep late because the curtains were very thin and the bright light would go through as if there were no curtains. It's so easy to have double curtains or dark curtains to solve the problem that I talked to one of the staff at the reception about that problem but although she listened, she seemed not to care at all. As for breakfast, it was even worse. The plates smelt bad...(You know this strong smell that you can get on dishes that is not well washed)...We tried to find 2 clean plates and tried to get something eatable. As for the coffee it was hot but tasted like water. I lived in London for almost 2 years and I had never had such a bad breakfast! The breakfast was so disgusting that we decided not to eat breakfast there anymore. I was really upset about the room and then about the breakfast. I could not understand how so many people could come down to breakfast. Because the hotel was probably fully booked and people did not care or were very hungry. I think you can find better places especially since, this is not really a hotel but more like a hostel with no taste, no service, no real room, a place just to sleep and nothing else. I would definitely not recommend this place to anyone. Unless this is the cheapest and most convenient in town!

Reviews.Title: “A bad choice”
Reviews.Author: gfalco
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my family for 3 nights to attend the concert of Genesis at Twickenham and for a short visit to London. I chose this hotel for its closeness to King's Cross and its low price, but these two features does not offset the bad services received. The room was dirty, smelly and too small for 4 people. The closure of the window was not working well, and so even the bathroom taps. The dining room was tiny for the number of guests and the breakfast was terrible: after the first morning I liked to have breakfast outside the hotel, although I had already paid for the bed and breakfast. I think I will not ever return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A "comfortable enough" budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: emeraldy92
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the European Hotel for 2 nights so I could sit my exams which were on Grays Inn Road so the location was just fantastic plus being off the main road opposite Kings Cross meant that it was a minute walk to get on the tube and head anywhere! I stayed in a single room and the bed was comfy and the room was clean and presentable (I'm overlooking the men's undercrackers which I found on the window ledge when I drew the curtain as an event which I would rather forget! ....err moving on.....). The shower pressure was a bit rubbish but was expected, the tv had great reception - unexpected and plenty of drawers etc to put things away in. Admittedly, there may not be much room to swing a cat but for a budget hotel it was plenty fine...had everything I needed and the teabags were topped up daily which was fab as three is definately not enough to last a revising student for one day let alone two! Breakfast was fine...I had read the previous reviews so was prepared that the cold drink of choice was orange squash and not orange juice..but the eggs were good, the sausages were good and you could have as much as you wanted! To conclude, I would recommend this to all but, note, it is BUDGET! Other people leaving reviews may have forgotten this and, for London prices, you get what you pay for and if you want luxury this isn't it but it is a comfortable, alright room, for an alright price!

Reviews.Title: “European not as good as before”
Reviews.Author: LionelMeadows
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the European a year ago and it was fine. I went back two weeks ago and unfortunately it wasn't quite so good. I wanted a basic room and when I rang the week before the girl on reception said phone on the morning you are coming down to London and see if we have any rooms. Not very helpful. I rang the next day and got one of the more helpful receptionists who took my credit card no to hold the room for my first night. I was arriving the following Wed evening. When I arrived the following week the receptionist said they were fairly full but I was given a basic room as requested, Â£35 with the toilet at the end of the corridor and on the top floor. That was fine by me. The room 49A was actually a room divided in two hence 49 and 49A and there wasn't room to swing a cat. It was long and thin and when you lay on the bed the Tv which was high up on a bracket was facing the right hand side wall so you couldn't see it properly. Towel provided but no soap. The guy in 49 was coughing all evening and you could hear everything. He had his tv on till 4am. Breakfast was OK you help yourself to eggs bacon etc and the orange juice is orange squash mixed with water. They have a room to leave your luggage when you check out if your train or plane is later in the day. This is handy as KX left luggage are about Â£7.50 per bag to leave for up to 24 hrs. I found the reception staff helpful and would have stayed longer than three days but for the noise. When I stayed the previous year I got a big room on the top floor for Â£30 with the toilet at the end of the corridor and no noise. Pity this time it wasn't so good and I had to move to another hotel round the corner. Still for Â£35 for a single and with a great location and helpful receptionists I think it's a reasonable deal. If you get helpful people it does help but it's a bit hit and miss as they can vary so much even at the same hotel. This area has quite a few hotels around Argyll Square so I guess it's try them for one night and see what they are like.

Reviews.Title: “unsafe, dirty”
Reviews.Author: albertSeattle
Reviews.Content: We had to night over in London on the way to catch a plane at Luton and thought the location would be OK. For 60 pounds we expected something better and certainly not a ground floor room with a window that would not lock. I have not felt as unsafe in a hotel since my student days staying in two-bit hotels. The so-called bathroom was a tiny squalid affair, smaller than an airplane toilet. Breakfast was to die for - literally.

Reviews.Title: “little money spent on maintainance, little comfort but cheap.”
Reviews.Author: kirst74
Reviews.Content: Location of hotel was very good, staff friendly. The room and bathroom were tiny, but clean. Also very shabby, with damp, peeling wallpaper and needed kettle to be replaced which was quickly done. Luckily we saw the humour of this after a 5 hour rail journey. Unfortunately was double booked on second trip to london and was sent to their 'sister hotel' round the corner. Room was top of building, small and cofffin sized, dirty and bleak, bleak, bleak. Not what was wanted to return to after a hectic day of site seeing in london. Don't go there!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: pbwm2
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in the hotel for 4 nights and enjoyed it. The room had plenty of space for 4 persons and was very clean. The stuff was nice, I remember the April 01th joke when we arrived, very nice, I loved it, because the woman who made it rembered us the whole time we stayed at the hotel. We will come back next eastern, but not on April 1th. The breakfast wasour favorite breakfast,full englisch. Thank you to the nice lady who invited us on the first day at the hotel, what a lovely welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: cyalady
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the 2nd block up from Kings Crossing. VERY easy access from the tube station. I have a bad back and hip and had requested an easy access room. I was accommodated with the best room possible, on the first floor and near check in. I knew the room would be small so I wasn't surprised at the size. The bath room was also tiny but it was our private bath. The room was very clean and looked fresh. Having read some of the reviews, I didn't know what to expect. I was very pleased with this hotel and the price compared to others in the area. The locality of the hotel to everything is easy since the tube station is so close. Kings Crossing is a major station with at least 5 or 6 different lines leaving the station. St. Pancras train station is next to the tube station also. Bus stops are everywhere. There are even 2 McDonalds restaurants within walking distance. I recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a great deal on a quaint hotel room with easy access to all the sites in London. There was no internet access available, but we were told we could go sit in the lobby of the Carlton Hotel which is on the corner of Argyle and Euston and use Wi Fi. McDonalds also has free Wi Fi. They also offered free English breakfast in the mornings. Hope this helps others.

Reviews.Title: “Freezing Cold Rooms”
Reviews.Author: casey006
Reviews.Content: On first entering the bedroom my chest contorted. Although newly decorated the room was musty and damp and the new paint was already peeling off the freshly plastered walls-a damp patch about a foot wide was clearly visible. The window was soaking wet cos it was so cold outside. The one small radiator gave off no heat whatsoever. Some foreign guy checked the radiator early Saturday morning, waking us up at stupid o'clock after a rather heavy night out. It was too cold to even attempt a shower. On returning to the room at 11.00 p.m. on Saturday evening the nice maid had left the window open all day (there was no key in the lock and we had to manoeuvre the lock into the hole before the window would close). The already freezing cold room was now Baltic. The radiator which was checked in the morning promptly went off, never to come back on. I honestly thought I was going to die of hypothermia. The location however was great - even for the prostitutes!!!! Don't stay here - pay an extra twenty quid and go somewhere at least warm.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: Drake_Sheldon
Reviews.Content: I can only agree with a lot of the negative comments already posted about this hotel. The rooms are small, but not helped by being crammed full of unecessary furniture (a lot of which is broken!) The bathroom was a little skanky and the water in the shower was only lukewarm. The bed was not secure on the floor and kept moving around. Also there is no lift in the hotel so we had to carry our suitcases up four flights of stairs. The breakfast is extremely cheap and the staff look too harassed to make sure you have what you need, toast, etc. The only plus point is the location - 2 minutes walk from Kings Cross Station. We only stayed here because of the cheap rate and for the fact that we wouldn't be spending much time in the actual room. All in all this hotel is best avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Just Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: Gracey99
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a 'cheap and cheerful' place to lay our heads before we went to Paris the following day. I wasn't expecting a lot but reviews I had read online had all been positive and with the friendly lady on reception when we first walked in things were looking good! But to say the room was disgusting is the biggest understatement!! I have never felt so unsafe anywhere; we didn't feel we could have our window open because it was so close to the neighbouring flats that we felt you could walk onto one of the balconies! The room was tiny and stuffed full of unnecessary furniture. The bathroom door had no handle on the inside which meant that each time we went to use it the other person had to hold the door shut. The room was dirty and smelt very musty. The light switches were not attached to the wall properly which, correct me if Iâ€™m wrong is a tad dangerous!! We felt so unsafe in the room we actually left one and a half hours before we needed to...not that anyone would have noticed because the reception was unmanned. I can't comment on breakfast as we were not offered it at the early hour we left (despite having paid for it). I'm sure there must be decent, cheap accommodation somewhere in London...just don't expect it from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague!”
Reviews.Author: GigglingGirl
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend break in London and stayed at the European Hotel. To say this hotel was basic was an understatement. Yes the location is ideal for tourists but that was about the only good thing about it and I would seriously recommend people to stay elsewhere if at all possible. Firstly there is no interaction with the staff and guests, I tried to engage in a pleasant conversation with the receptionist but was brushed off. Then when we entered the room it went downhill from there. We envisaged the room to be small and basic and this was as we thought but with further disappointments. Firstly the cupboards scattered around the room were all at funny odd angles and made the room seem even smaller. You had to climb over the bed to get to the otherside of the room. The wardrobe rail was broken and we had to fix ourselves in order to hang our clothes, the TV had not got good reception on a couple channels (which although we thought wouldn't matter one night when we stayed in it was this channel which had the movies on!) The shower which ajoined (we paid extra for a private bathroom) was too small to get dry, the shower was falling apart at the top and with only two small towels it was not good - we had to use one towel for the floor as no matter what we did water seemed to go everwhere. It reminded me of a cheap self accommodation apartment abroad not London! The shower had a hole in the floor to it and the toilet, again placed at an odd angle, had no toilet roll holder so you had to reach up to the top of the toilet to get some. The room seemed to stay moist when you had a shower and brought about a heat in the bedroom. Luckily the only good thing about this was that of the fan above the bed. However when I stood on the bed to pull the string to turn it on I couldn't reach, it was too high up, luckily my partner could reach but only just. Unfortunately the plumbing must be faulty as everytime anyone else in the hotel was running a tap, having a shower, using the toilet a loud gurgling sound would emerge from the shower hole and in order to sleep at night we had to block with one towel to get peace!!! In addition sleeping facing the front had a view of a small little park, nothing to brag about, and it was noisy at night so sleep was lacking. The breakfast - I was so looking forward to this, however it was cheap and nasty. The food looked like it was sitting a while in a buffet style container and the cereal in open containers. My partner, who never says no to a good fry up, passed on breakfast and ate a bit of toast that we were given. It was not a full english fry as anticipated but cheap thin sausages with no taste, bacon very undercooked, some cheap tinned tomatoes and beans and eggs that had just been sat there. No mushrooms, hash browns, even black pudding. Very disappointing. I would like to point out that on the first day when we came back after a day of sightseeing before going for dinner we wanted a drink in the room, it was wet and we wanted a hot drink, unfortunately the maid had not cleaned the room fully and we had not been given clean cups and more tea/coffee to use. I went down to ask for more and the receptionist, rudely brushed me off and told me to 'help myself' in the open kitchen - when I went in I was disgusted. It was the first day in the hotel and from what I saw in there I didn't go to breakfast for even toast for the remainder of the stay. Milk left lying out, cereals still uncovered left lying for the next day, cheap food and bread pushed into the freezers in abundance. Nothing was fresh and looked after. So as you can imagine I would not recommend this hotel to anyone even my worst enemy. It is ok if you don't eat, are extremely tiny and an insomniac but to people who like sleep, do not like avoiding cupboards, like to eat a good breakfast to start the day off and like peace / quiet don't go. Although you think it's fine for the price it's not, it's beyond basic.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: bryan&rowena
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in London. Stayed at the European Hotel, Kings Cross, London. Good Points- Location- Hotel is just a 2 minute walk from Kings cross station underground so it is ideal for getting about London. The look of the hotel on the outside is nice. There is also a lovely little park right across the road so if you get good weather it's a good bit to sun yourself and relax with your booking you will get a good breakfast in the morning. Mainly Full english fry up and some cereals, juices, toast and coffee/tea. Ideal start to the day. Kettle/ tea/ coffee in your room The price we paid for London was fantastic. Â£120 for 2 nights inc breakfast. hard to beat in price. Bad Points- Room was small and cramped and the interior decor a little dated. We were in a room on the lower floor basement area and I was a little concerned that the window didn't lock as there were other rooms and windows adjacent. The reception area was a bit sparse and basic looking. The general standard in the room was poor. Loose shower holder, damp patches on ceiling and no lampshade in room. Lack of attention to detail. In summing up- The hotel was cheap and cheerful but to be honest we spent very little time in it so for a bed for the night and a good breakfast in the morning it was fine. Basically as the saying goes you only get what you pay for. Would I go again to this hotel. Maybe not. Best described as adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Suitable for nights”
Reviews.Author: Kaasmeisje
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in the European Hotel and I got exactly what I expected. A small room but with all the facilities you need(bed, shower, toilet, tv and kettle). Nice breakfast. Location is great and prices are reasonable. It is not exactly top-of-the-range, but if you are only in for the nights it suits the purpose.

Reviews.Title: “much better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: Signe_7
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a booking agency opposite Kings Cross station. I was lucky to have a twin room for my sister and me in such a short notice as the London Marathon was on the Sunday when we expected to leave. When I went to the hotel to confirm my booking, the lady in the reception was very helpful and told me to go and see the room before I took it. At that moment I was more than happy to have a room since our mother had ahd an accident and we really just wanted to have a roof on our heads,. The breakfast was better than in many of the hotels in the area (we had stayed in many hotels in the area since there werent many places to stay for long time at such short notice), they had a buffet breakfast, beans, toast, eggs scrambled and fried, bacon, tea, coffee, juice.. well worth the 5 quid extra from the other hotels in the area. Our room was in the basement, but that was what we preferred, having quite a lot of luggage that we didn't want to carry up and down the stairs. We had a twin room, comfortable beds, nice enough en suite and amazingly no noise at all during the night. The twin room was quite enough for us two gals at a very reasonable price. This wasn't my first choice of hotels in the area, but at the emergengy we had, we were pleasantly surprised to have had such good value. Would consider staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: libbyrose
Reviews.Content: My other half and I stayed here for one night last week. You get what you pay for sums up the night. The room was small and the bed was not a double, more like a 4ft. The walls were paper thing and the wardrobe was tipping over. The heating would not turn off, so we just opened the window, though this would be a problem in summer months. The bathroom was fine although I have never seen a toilet at such a weird angle and the towel rail was coming off the wall. It did appear to be clean though. However all this said the room is liveable for one night and I didn't really expect much., and it did have a brillant location, literally a second away from Kings Cross Station in a quiet square away from the main road. What I found to be the most dissappointing was the staff, they were very rude and short. When we arrived very little conversation was given, just shoved the keys at us and said third floor. But when we came down for breakfast the following morning I was extremely put off. We came down just before 9 as no one had told us when breakfast was scheduled. I was greeted by a waitress who basically shouted in my face that breakfast was over and I must leave. I could not believe how rude she was, she could of just politely told me. Overall it's fine for a night but no more, and if I was you make sure you go down for breakfast at 8. I would not stay there again though.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: PetrCzech
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and myself have just returned from a 5 night break in London where we stayed in European Hotel. European hotel is easy to find - it's about 150m from King's Cross St. Pancras station, which is operated by many underground services, national and international rail services. It takes 3 tube stations to get Oxford Circus. The hotel has no lift, but if you take your luggages only at check-in/out, it's no problem. We take a double room on second floor, the room was small enough to fit the bed, TV and very narrow furniture including wardrobe, bed table and little writing table. There were private bathroom with toilet together. Bathroom is too small that you need only one step from using toilet to take a shower :-) No problems with water, no problems with lining (changed during stay, clean). Breakfasts included tea, coffee, juice, milk, toasts, beans (which i never like to eat before!), sausages, bacon, egss. No problem with staff. I got what i pay for.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: 2schlaffs
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was better than expected, however, we arrived in London after a really, really horrible week in India where we stayed in completely filthy accomodations and had everything that could go wrong, go terribly wrong. So, I know our perspective was a bit different...that being said, our room was older, but appeared clean. There was a lot of pot smoke throughout the hallways and some very noisy guests at night, but we were obviously fortunate not to have some of the intense problems with other guests and/or staff that other travelers have had.

Reviews.Title: “Called Police At Night !!!”
Reviews.Author: fomalgaut4
Reviews.Content: Have you ever called police at night during your stay at a hotel? The European Hotel will give you such an opportunity. During all night drunk company of truck drivers terrorised the floor where we stayed. African British receptionist was unable to stop them. I locked my door which they tried to breake down and called police. When policemen arrived the company suddenly became slipping. If you like such as attractions - welcome to European hotel. You will get memories for the rest of your life.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting filthy smelly,”
Reviews.Author: starfruitmt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the worse place i have ever stayed i would not send my worse enemy here, The staff are rude , the rooms are filthy, and as for health and saftey will it does not excist here, i had wires hanging under the sink, paper ripped of the wall damp room .On our first night we payed in full and whent to bed , at about 3am we heard banging on our door which woke us up and then a key being inserted and tried to open the room ,we asked who it was and it was the very rude night reception saying he had gave us to much money back , we told him we had been asleep and we would check and go to the desk in the morning with the money and aq complaint. , thnk god we was oinly here for three nights ; please please please do not stay here you have been warned

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: cherryh
Reviews.Content: this is my 3rd try to add a review for the european hotel (argyle square). it never got published, maybe because it's a quite negative one. i'm trying again. stay was july 6-8 (silverstone, f1 time!), 2007, had a cellar room for 3 people, wallpapers peeling off the walls, walls moist, room cold, loud, as it was underneath the stairs and people were climbing up and down most of the time. felt like the thunder at night. bathroom: icecold, stone floor, no rugs. breakfast was not bad, staff had partially problems understanding english. summary - never again.

Reviews.Title: “Lots to be desired”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveller077
Reviews.Content: The room was small but okay, they were old with stained wall paper and in need of some major updating. The showers were useable but I still wore flip-flops and wrapped the toilet seat. I brought my own pillow case and used it. For the price it left a lot to be desired. Location was very close to the tube. We found the staff nice enough but only because we engaged them in conversation.

Reviews.Title: “On arriaval at this "Hotel".................”
Reviews.Author: frankedinburgh
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 day work trip,staying in this "hotel" On arriival was greeted by receptionist who, apart from lacking in any customer care skills, proceeded to tell her assembled audience (myself and other guests waiting to check-in) what a stressful and busy time she was having!!! Wasted little time in asking method of payment before handing over room keys with vague directions to the allocated room(too stressed to do that I suppose) Room was on top floor, very small but clean. Top cover of bed had two fag burns(intrestingly there is a notice asking guests NOT to smoke in room, but they provide an ashtray in each room!!) Bathroom tiny with taps not secured onto sink, shower right next to toilet Breakfast was ok. Best thing about this place is it's closeness to Kings Cross and tubes. My overall rating? 2 / 10

Reviews.Title: “Grim”
Reviews.Author: LeedsBob
Reviews.Content: Avoid like the plague, because that's what you might catch. The only positive was clean sheets. Room had the smallest 'bathroom' I've ever seen, and it stank - my girlfriend refused to use the shower. TV was one channel only with a remote that clearly belonged to another TV. Too hot in the room - heating on all night with no control over this. Didn't bother with the breakfast, so can't comment on that. Relatively cheap, but certainly not cheerful. Spend another 20 quid and get somewhere decent would be my advice.

Reviews.Title: “Stole my money”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlBudapest
Reviews.Content: I booked a room in the European hotel, but when i arrived there I got somewhat scared. I was travelling alone and a girl in that area alone is not the safest thing, not mentioning that the hotel was in terrible condition. I went back to the reception and told them my problem. SInce i payed with credit card for the first week they told me I will get back my money- appart from the frirst night- on the next business day. Its been two months now and I havent seen any money back, furthermore they also charged me for the second week. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible and tatty”
Reviews.Author: laurakirstie
Reviews.Content: There were 4 of us staying at this hotel. We were given two double rooms in the basement which had a strong damp smell. We asked to be moved and were given another two rooms, which were similar but without the smell. The rooms are tiny, there was wallpaper peeling off the walls and the skirting boards are dirty. The shower had old chewing gum stuck to the wall near ceiling and the sink was blocked. The breakfast is ok if a little greasy. The only good thing was a clean bed.

HotelInfo.Name: European Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 11-15 Argyle Square, London WC1H 8AS, England
